patterns: Where is the thyroid gland located?
responses: A butterfly-shaped organ located at the base of your neck.
This organ releases hormones that controls your metabolism! It's at the base of your neck.
Hyperthyroidism means an overactive thyroid gland. Your gland will produce more hormones than needed.
Hyperthyroid can accelerate your body's metabolism

patterns: What are the symptoms of hyperthyroidism?
What are symptoms of an overactive thyroid?
responses: The symptoms are: rapid weight loss, irregular or fast paced heartbeat & heat intolerance.
You may lose weight pretty fast due to hyperthyroidism!

patterns: Why does hyperthyroid cause weight loss?
responses: Your metabolism goes on overdrive, causing weight loss.
High level of hormonal imbalance can cause rapid weight loss.

patterns: Why does heartbeat increase in thyroid?
How does heartbeat and thyroid related?
responses: Excess thyroid hormones causes palpitations.
You thyroid hormone interferes with the nervous system's control of the heart.

patterns: How does nervous system control heart?
responses: Heart rate is controlled by two branches of the nervous system: The sympathetic (SNS) and parasympathetic nervous system (PNS). The SNS releases hormones to accelerate heart rate. PNS releases hormones to slow the heart rate.

patterns: Why does thyroid provide heat intolerance?
responses: Hyperthyroidism may cause sensitivity to heat and excessive heating.
Hyperthyroid can accelerate your body's metabolism, casuing heat to go away from body quickly.

patterns: Does thyroid have any abnormal shape?
responses: An abnormal enlargement of the thyroid gland. May cause a cough and make it difficult to swallow or breathe. So go to your doctor to get it checked!

patterns: Do people have short breath during thyroid?
responses: Hyperthyroidism weakens the respiratory muscles and decreases lung function.

patterns: Give me some tips on eating healthy food
responses: Emphasize on vegetables, fruits, whole grain and fat-free or low-fat dairy products. Control portion sizes. Includes lean meats, fish, poultry and eggs for growth!

responses: Protein: Hand's palm worth of meat/fish/chicken. Carbohydrates: 1 cupped hand worth of carbohydrates. Vegetables: 1 hand fist worth serving of vegetables or more!. Fats: Only  thumb worth of serving

patterns: Health tips to prevent thyroid disease?
responses: Make sure to wear a thyroid collar during x-rays to prevent radiation exposure to the thyroid gland. Quit Smoking and if your experience dip in your energy levels, visit the doctor for a thyroid checkup.

Obesity is generally caused by eating too much and moving too little. If you consume high amounts of carbs, fats and sugar and do not burn off that energy, these nutrients will be stored as fat reserves, contributing to obesity.

patterns: Does obesity have anything to do with genes?
responses: Rare single-gene defects cause severe obesity beginning in early childhood and are associated with extremely high levels of hunger. Maybe due to Leptin Deficiency, POMC Deficiency, MC4R Deficiency

patterns: Do you know any good breakfast options?
responses: A good breakfast must consist of good amount of carbs, protein, fats and veggies to keep you prepped for the day. Some recipes to try are: Avocado Toast with Egg; Nut Butter, Banana, and Chia Seed Toast; Tomato Toast with ricotta.

patterns: Do you know any good lunch options?
responses: Lunch is an exciting part of the day and you can make anything you like (not high sugar obviously!). Some recipes to try are: BBQ chicken salad, greek yoghurt chicken salad sandwich, burrito bowls, and steak fajita salad to name a few

patterns: Do you know any good dinner options?
responses: Dinner is best kept light and clean so you can have a good nights sleep! Some recipes to try are: Pan fried fish with greens, chicken parm stuffed peppers, skinny alfredo pasta, and roast chicken with veggies are some of my favorites

patterns: Do you know any good snack options?
responses: Eating snacks is actually really good to keep your hunger pangs at bay if you know how to eat right! Some snacks to try are: minxed nutes, greek yoghurt with mixed berries, apple slices with peanut butter, kale chips are some of my favorite things to have!!

patterns: Do you know any good smoothies?
responses: Smoothies are a great way to get in your fruits and amp up those vitamins for a healthy body! Some recipes to try are: Berry and Yogurt Smoothie; Peanut Butter and Banana Smoothie (my favorite) are some to try!

Water intake is essential for a healthy functioning body. Start your day with one or two glasses of water to activate your digestive system. Drink atleast 1.5 litres of water per day. Add some fruits or honey to the water if you like since they can amp up the flavor and make water drinking enjoyable!

patterns: Can you suggest some exercises for underweight?
I'm underweight. Can you tell me what exercises to do?
responses: Start an exercises routine by building yourself a workout program, or better to join a gym or any communal workout areas. Exercise every part of your body. Most importantly, do strength training and limit on cardiovascular workouts.

patterns: Can you suggest some exercises for overweight?
I'm overweight. Can you tell me what exercises to do?
responses: Start lifting some weights as they build lean muscle and cut fat, leading to toned body shape. Perform swimming or water exercises which burns tons of calories. Make sure to stay active during the day by walking.

patterns: Can you tell me any junk foods I can avoid.
responses: Avoid sugary drinks and opt for water or fresh juice. Don't eat pizzas but rather make your own flatbread with healthy toppings. Avoid breakfast cereals and opt for oats or muesli which is packed with fiber and vitamins. Avoid cookies and dessert and instead go for a cup of fruit salad, yoghurt with fruits, or dark chocolate.
